article.title: Arizona_Diamondbacks

template.arg: Sedona red, Sonoran sand, black, white{{cite web|last
The D-backs, The Snakes, The Rattlesnakes

{{hlist| [[2011 Arizona Diamondbacks season|2011]] | [[2007 Arizona Diamondbacks season|2007]] | [[2002 Arizona Diamondbacks season|2002]] | [[2001 Arizona Diamondbacks season|2001]] | [[1999 Arizona Diamondbacks season|1999]] }}

article.paragraph: TheArizona Diamondbacks(often shortened as theD-Backs) are an Americanprofessional baseballprofessional baseball teambased inPhoenix, Arizona. The club plays in theNational League WestWestdivision of theNational League(NL) inMajor League Baseball(MLB). Since the team's inception in 1998, the franchise has played home games atChase Field, formerly known as Bank One Ballpark. TheBaseball parkballparkwas renamed in 2005, as a result ofBank One Corporation's merger withJPMorgan ChaseJPMorgan Chase & Co.The Diamondbacks have won oneWorld Serieschampionship (in2001 World Series2001), becoming the fastestexpansion teamin the Major Leagues to win a championship, doing it in only the fourth season since1998 Major League Baseball expansionthe franchise's inceptionin the1998 Major League Baseball season.
article.heading: Franchise history
article.paragraph: On March 9, 1995, Arizona was1998 Major League Baseball expansionawarded a franchiseto begin play for the 1998 season. A $130 million franchise fee was paid to Major League Baseball and on January 16, 1997, the Diamondbacks were officially voted into the National League.cite newsBaseball Expansion Teams Put in LeaguesJanuary 17, 1997Southeastern Missourian
Since their debut, the Diamondbacks have won fiveNational League Westtitles, one National League Championship pennant, and the2001 World Series.
article.heading: Logos
article.paragraph: The Diamondbacks' original colors werepurple,black,teal (color)tealandcopper (color)copper."D-backs shed their skin after unveiling new uniforms, colors on runway," Arizona Diamondbacks press release, Wednesday, November 8, 2006.Their first logo was an italicized block letter "A" with a diamond pattern and a snake's tongue. Prior to their inaugural season, they released their baseball caps. The home cap had a cream color crown with a purple visor and button. The road cap was black and had a turquoise visor and button. Their alternate cap had a turquoise crown with a purple visor and button. Depending on the cap, the "A" logo on the front of the cap had different color variations.

In the Diamondbacks' second season, they introduced a new logo which was a copper color snake in the shape of a letter "D". It was used on a solid black cap, which in the beginning, was worn as a road cap.

The franchise unveiled new uniforms and colors of Sedona Red, Sonoran Sand and black on November 8, 2006. Theredshade is named for thesandstonecanyonatRed Rock State ParknearSedona, ArizonaSedona, while thebeige(sand) shade is named for theSonoran Desert.A sleeve patch was added featuring a lowercase "d" and "b" configured to look like a snake's head.The team also kept the "D" logo, but was slightly altered and put on an all red cap to be used as their game cap. They also kept the "A" logo with the new colors applied to it, with a solid black cap used as the alternate cap. A similar color scheme is currently used by theArizona Coyotesof theNational Hockey League.
article.heading: Media
article.paragraph: The primary television play-by-play voice for the team's first nine seasons of play wasThom Brennaman, who also broadcasts baseball andcollege footballgames nationally forMajor League Baseball on FoxFox Television. Brennaman was the TV announcer for theChicago CubsandCincinnati Reds(along with his fatherMarty Brennaman) before being hired by Diamondbacks founder Jerry Colangelo in 1996, two years before the team would begin play.
In October 2006, Brennaman left the Diamondbacks to call games with his father for the Reds beginning in 2007, signing a four-year deal (his FOX duties remained unchanged).

The English language flagship radio station isKTAR (AM)KTAR.Greg Schulteis the regular radio play-by-play voice, a 25-year veteran of sports radio in the Phoenix market, also well known for his previous work onPhoenix Suns,Arizona CardinalsandArizona State University(ASU) broadcasts.

Jeff Munnis a backup radio play-by-play announcer; he served as the regular public address announcer atChase Fieldin the early days of the franchise. He is well-known to many Phoenix area sports fans, having also served as the public address announcer for the Suns at America West Arena (nowTalking Stick Resort Arena) in the 1990s. He is also the play-by-play radio voice for ASU women's basketball.

On November 1, 2006, the team announced that the TV voice of theMilwaukee Brewerssince 2002,Daron Sutton, would be hired as the Diamondbacks primary TV play-by-play voice. Sutton was signed to a five-year contract with a team option for three more years. Sutton is considered one of the best of the younger generation of baseball broadcasters. His signature chants include "let's get some runs" when the D'Backs trail in late innings. Sutton's father isMajor League Baseball Hall of FameHall of Famepitcher and currentAtlanta BravesbroadcasterDon Sutton.cite webhttp://arizona.diamondbacks.mlb.com/NASApp/mlb/news/press_releases/press_release.jsp?ymdMLB.comArizona.diamondbacks.mlb.comSeptember 7, 2010

Former Diamondback and Chicago CubMark Graceand former Major LeagueknuckleballpitcherTom Candiottiwere the Diamondbacks primary color analysts for the 2006 and 2007 seasons. Former Diamondback playerMatt Williams (third baseman)Matt Williamsalso does color commentary on occasion, as does formerSt. Louis CardinalsCardinalsandNBCbroadcast legendJoe Garagiola, Sr., a longtime Phoenix-area resident and father ofJoe Garagiola, Jr., the first GM of the Diamondbacks (as head of the Maricopa County Sports Authority in the early 1990s, Garagiola, Jr. was one of the primary people involved in Phoenix obtaining a Major League Baseball franchise).

The Diamondbacks announced in July 2007cite webhttp://arizona.diamondbacks.mlb.com/news/press_releases/press_release.jsp?ymdFSN Arizona to become exclusive TV home for the D'Backs starting next season | Dbacks.com: Official InfoArizona.diamondbacks.mlb.comSeptember 7, 2010that for the 2008 season, all regionally broadcast Diamondback TV games will be shown exclusively onFox Sports Arizona, and a few could possibly be shown on the nationalMajor League Baseball on FoxMLB on Foxtelecasts. Fox Sports Arizona (or FSArizona) is currently seen in 2.8 million households in Arizona and New Mexico. The previous flagship station, since the inaugural 1998 season, wasKTVK, a popular over-the-air independent station in Phoenix.

From 2009 to 2012, Mark Grace and Daron Sutton were tagged as the main broadcasters of the Diamondbacks with pre-game and postgame shows on FSArizona, being hosted by former big-league closerJoe Borowski (baseball)Joe Borowski.

On June 21, 2012, Daron Sutton was suspended indefinitely, amid rumors of insubordination.cite webPiecoroNickArizona Diamondbacks SS Stephen Drew's ankle holds uphttp://www.azcentral.com/sports/diamondbacks/20120627arizona-diamondbacks-ss-stephen-drews-ankle-holds-up.htmlazcentral.comNovember 9, 2012Then on August 24, the team announced that Mark Grace had requested an indefinite leave of absence after being arrested for his second DUI in less than two yearscite webBoivinPaolaArizona Diamondbacks hit hard again in the public eyehttp://www.azcentral.com/sports/diamondbacks/articles/20120824arizona-diamondbacks-hit-hard-again-public-eye.htmlazcentralNovember 9, 2012(Grace was later indicted on four DUI countscite webMerrillLaurieMark Grace indicted on 4 DUI countshttp://www.azcentral.com/community/scottsdale/articles/20121025mark-grace-indicted-dui-counts.htmlThe Republicazcentral.comNovember 9, 2012). For the remainder of the 2012 season, Sutton was replaced by Greg Schulte (Jeff Munn replaced Schulte on the radio broadcast) and Grace was replaced by Luis Gonzalez. At the end of the 2012 season, the team announced that neither Sutton nor Grace would be returning for the 2013 season.cite webMarottaVinceDaron Sutton, Mark Grace out as Arizona Diamondbacks broadcastershttp://arizonasports.com/42/1579872/Darron-Sutton-Mark-Grace-out-as-Arizona-Diamondbacks-broadcastersArizona Sportsarizonasports.comNovember 9, 2012

On October 18, 2012, the team announced thatBob Brenlywould be returning as a broadcaster, and that he would be joined by then-ESPNpersonalitySteve Berthiaume.cite webPiecoroNickArizona Diamondbacks name Steve Berthiaume, Bob Brenly as TV announcing teamhttp://www.azcentral.com/sports/diamondbacks/articles/20121018arizona-diamondbacks-announcers-bob-brenly-steve-berthiaume.htmlazcentral sportsazcentral.comNovember 9, 2012
article.heading: Spanish broadcasts
article.paragraph: The flagship Spanish language radio station isKBMBAM 710 with Miguel Quintana, Richard Saenz and Oscar Soria.

Games were televised in Spanish onKPHE-LDKPHE-LPwith Oscar Soria and Jerry Romo as the announcersbut this arrangement ended prior to the 2009 season due to the team switching fully toFox Sports Arizonaand the lack of carriage of KHPE-LP on the Cox cable system.cite webPiecoroNickhttp://www.azcentral.com/sports/diamondbacks/articles/2009/01/22/20090122spt-dbackstv.htmlNo Spanish TV broadcasts for D'BacksAzcentral.comJanuary 22, 2009September 7, 2010
